availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Stafford and Celestia Stafford. Married to Martha Hager Stafford in Johnson County, Kentucky, on March 18, 1856. Father of William Worth Staffor, Henry M. Stafford, Christopher C. Stafford, V. Jane Stafford, and Robert Stafford. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Employed Rebecca Harrod as a domestic servant in Johnson County in 1860. Farmer in Johnson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 81A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriage Book, 1843-1875, Film #001912950, p. 1.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Johnson County, Vol. 2 of 3, October 1863, p. 353.
